title: Smart Data Models - CSV Dialect
description: The CSV dialect descriptor.Converted for Smart Data Models initiative from original frictionless data

csvddfVersion.description: Property. CSV Dialect schema version. A number to indicate the schema version of CSV Dialect. Version 1.0 was named CSV Dialect Description Format and used different field names

delimiter.description: Property. Delimiter. . A character sequence to use as the field separator

doubleQuote.description: Property. Double Quote. If Double Quote is set to true, two consecutive quotes must be interpreted as one. Specifies the handling of quotes inside fields

lineTerminator.description: Property. Line Terminator. . Specifies the character sequence that must be used to terminate rows

nullSequence.description: Property. Null Sequence. . Specifies the null sequence, for example, `\N`

quoteChar.description: Property. Quote Character. . Specifies a one-character string to use as the quoting character

escapeChar.description: Property. Escape Character. . Specifies a one-character string to use as the escape character

skipInitialSpace.description: Property. Skip Initial Space. . Specifies the interpretation of whitespace immediately following a delimiter. If false, whitespace immediately after a delimiter should be treated as part of the subsequent field

header.description: Property. Header. . Specifies if the file includes a header row, always as the first row in the file

commentChar.description: Property. Comment Character. . Specifies that any row beginning with this one-character string, without preceeding whitespace, causes the entire line to be ignored

caseSensitiveHeader.description: Property. Case Sensitive Header. Use of case in source CSV files is not always an intentional decision. For example, should "CAT" and "Cat" be considered to have the same meaning. Specifies if the case of headers is meaningful
